t: A Song and Psalm for the sons of Korah.
Great*p is the Lord,*s and greatly to be praised in the city of our God, in the mountain of his holiness.
Beautiful*p for situation, the joy of the whole earth, is mount Zion, on the sides of the north, the city of the great King.
God*p is known in her palaces for a refuge.
For,*p lo, the kings were assembled, they passed by together.
They*p saw it, and so they marvelled; they were troubled, and hasted away.
Fear*p took hold upon them there, and pain, as of a woman in travail.
Thou*p breakest the ships of Tarshish with an east wind.
As*p we have heard, so have we seen in the city of the Lord*s of hosts, in the city of our God: God will establish it for ever. Selah.
We*p have thought of thy lovingkindness, O God, in the midst of thy temple.
According*p to thy name, O God, so is thy praise unto the ends of the earth: thy right hand is full of righteousness.
Let*p mount Zion rejoice, let the daughters of Judah be glad, because of thy judgments.
Walk*p about Zion, and go round about her: tell the towers thereof.
Mark*p ye well her bulwarks, consider her palaces; that ye may tell it to the generation following.
For*p this God is our God for ever and ever: he will be our guide even unto death.
